str2: Each (of more than two), every one. As if a superlative of hekas; each or every.
According to the manner in which, in the degree that, just as, as. From kata and hos; just as, that.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From pro and haireomai; to choose for oneself before another thing, i.e. to propose.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Prolonged from a primary kar; the heart, i.e. the thoughts or feelings; also the middle.
Not, lest. A primary particle of qualified negation; not, lest; also (whereas ou expects an affirmative one) whether.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
Pain, grief, sorrow, affliction. Apparently a primary word; sadness.
Or, than. A primary particle of distinction between two connected terms; disjunctive, or; comparative, than.
From ana and the base of agkale; constraint; by implication, distress.
For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To love, wish well to, take pleasure in, long for; denotes the love of reason, esteem. Perhaps from agan; to love.
Joyous, cheerful, not grudging. From the same as hileos; propitious or merry, i.e. Prompt or willing.
A giver. From the base of didomi; a giver.
